metadata.title: Procedural Enclosure Toolkit - Case Law Database
metadata.verification_required: All citations must be verified by user. Check for overruling, distinguishing, or limiting subsequent decisions.
metadata.note: Includes only key precedents for procedural enforcement. Not exhaustive.

cases.name: Apfel v. Prudential-Bache Securities Inc.
cases.holding: CPLR §2219(a) requires all orders to contain written statement of grounds. Oral decisions insufficient.
cases.key_quote: Every order shall be in writing and contain... a statement of the grounds therefor.
cases.relevance: Core authority for procedural enclosure demanding written orders

cases.name: Lohnas v. Luzi
cases.holding: Written order must state grounds with sufficient specificity to permit meaningful appellate review.
cases.relevance: Establishes specificity requirement for written orders

cases.name: Feinberg v. Feit
cases.holding: Order without written findings is nullity; reversed for new hearing.

cases.name: Kolisnyk v. County of Monroe
cases.holding: Mandamus available to compel performance of ministerial duty where clear legal right exists.

cases.name: Klostermann v. Cuomo
cases.holding: Article 78 standard of review for administrative determinations.

cases.name: Matter of Holtzman v. Goldman
cases.holding: Mandamus will not lie to control judicial discretion; only to compel ministerial acts.

cases.name: Telemark v. Telemark
cases.holding: Failure to preserve issue for appeal by specific objection waives appellate review.

cases.name: People v. Cona
cases.holding: Appellate court reviews law de novo; facts for substantial evidence.

cases.name: William Karl Realty Corp. v. 420 W. 204th St. Realty LLC
cases.holding: Stay pending appeal requires: (1) likelihood of success on merits; (2) irreparable injury; (3) balance of equities; (4) public interest.

cases.name: Doe v. Axelrod
cases.holding: Irreparable injury standard for preliminary injunction and stay.

cases.name: Matter of Gould v. New York City Police Dept.
cases.holding: FOIL requires disclosure unless specific exemption applies. Burden on agency to prove exemption.

cases.name: Matter of Fink v. Lefkowitz
cases.holding: FOIL is to be liberally construed in favor of access. Exemptions narrowly construed.

cases.name: Monroe v. Pape
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: §1983 provides remedy for constitutional violations by state actors under color of law.

cases.name: Monell v. Department of Social Services
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Municipalities liable under §1983 for constitutional violations pursuant to official policy or custom.

cases.name: Harlow v. Fitzgerald
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Qualified immunity shields government officials unless they violated clearly established constitutional rights.

cases.name: Mathews v. Eldridge
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Due process requires balancing: (1) private interest affected; (2) risk of erroneous deprivation; (3) government interest.

cases.name: Goldberg v. Kelly
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Due process requires notice and hearing before deprivation of property or liberty interest.

cases.name: Duchesne v. Sugarman
cases.holding: Parent-child relationship is liberty interest protected by due process. Procedural violations in family court warrant relief.
cases.relevance: Due process in family court proceedings (Second Circuit)

cases.name: Kia P. v. McIntyre
cases.holding: State must provide constitutionally adequate procedures before terminating parental rights.

cases.name: Younger v. Harris
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Federal courts abstain from interfering in ongoing state judicial proceedings absent extraordinary circumstances.
cases.relevance: Younger abstention limits federal intervention in state courts

cases.name: Rooker v. Fidelity Trust Co.
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Federal district courts lack jurisdiction to review state court judgments (only Supreme Court has jurisdiction).
cases.relevance: Rooker-Feldman doctrine bars federal review of state judgments

cases.name: Cheney v. U.S. District Court
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Mandamus is 'drastic remedy' available only when: (1) clear legal right; (2) no adequate alternative; (3) ministerial duty.

cases.name: Winter v. Natural Resources Defense Council
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.holding: Preliminary injunction requires: (1) likelihood of success; (2) irreparable harm; (3) balance of equities; (4) public interest.

usage_notes.citation_format: Follow Bluebook format for legal citations

verification.step_1: Use Justia, Google Scholar, or official reporters to verify case citations
verification.step_2: Check for subsequent history (overruled, distinguished, limited)
verification.step_3: Verify holding accurately represents court's decision
verification.step_4: Confirm case is still good law (use Shepardizing or KeyCite if available)

usage_notes.string_cites: When using multiple cases for same proposition, cite most recent and authoritative first
usage_notes.pinpoint_cites: Always include page numbers (pinpoint citations) when quoting or referencing specific holdings
